entry.title: Code Talk: Moving to Zero Trust architecture on AWS

link.title: Code Talk: Moving to Zero Trust architecture on AWS

entry.content:
25 July 2024

Code Talk: Moving to Zero Trust architecture on AWS

Hosts:
Tom

Guests:
Adam Palmer, Principal Solutions Architect, Networking
Pablo Sánchez Carmona, Sr. Solutions Architect, Networking

Abstract:
This is a Code Talk, so time to learn while we code! Today, learn how you can use AWS Verified Access and Amazon VPC Lattice to implement a Zero Trust security model on AWS. Learn best practices to create least-privilege access and microsegmentation across workloads. Additionally, find out how infrastructure as code can enable automated deployment and management of robust Zero Trust environments. Sounds good? Join us!
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: All Things Support, and Lessons Learned

link.title: All Things Support, and Lessons Learned

entry.content:
18 July 2024

All Things Support, and Lessons Learned

Hosts:
Matt
Jamie

Guests:
Felipe da Silva, Principal SA App Networking

Abstract:
In this session we will talk about how Support works. What they do to figure out a problem. How to determine if something is a bug or misconfiguration. Common gotchas and advise on how to deploy AWS networking constructs for scale, security and reliablility
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Supercharge Your Network Engineering: Harnessing GenAI Tools for Enhanced Productivity

link.title: Supercharge Your Network Engineering: Harnessing GenAI Tools for Enhanced Productivity

entry.content:
11 July 2024

Supercharge Your Network Engineering: Harnessing GenAI Tools for Enhanced Productivity

Hosts:
Jamie

Guests:
Du'An Lightfoot, Sr. Developer Advocate
Sid Chauhan, Principal Solutions Architect

Abstract:
Discover how generative AI is revolutionizing the daily work of network engineers. Tune in to learn how to leverage cutting-edge AI assistants to boost your productivity and streamline complex tasks such as:

1) RAG-Powered Knowledge Basics: Enhancing your troubleshooting with AI that understands network contexts.
2) Amazon Bedrock Agents: Creating your personal AI network assistant for faster problem solving.
3) Amazon Q Developer: Accelerating NetDevOps workflows and automating code generation.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Evolution of enterprise networking in the cloud

link.title: Evolution of enterprise networking in the cloud

entry.content:
27 June 2024

Evolution of enterprise networking in the cloud

Hosts:
Jamie

Guests:
Andrew Gray, Principal Solutions Architect, Networking
Scott Morrison, Sr. Solutions Architect, Networking

Abstract:
Let's talk about enterprise networking evolution! We have Andrew Gray and Scott Morrison, who have tenure in the traditional and cloud networking worlds. We will hear about their experiences as they have seen traditional networking and cloud networking evolve. In this fireside chat, we will explore where the networking world is going based on their experience. Bring your questions!
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Simplify DNS management using Route 53 Profiles

link.title: Simplify DNS management using Route 53 Profiles

entry.content:
20 June 2024

Simplify DNS management using Route 53 Profiles

Hosts:
Riggs

Guests:
Adhish Bhobe, Sr. Product Manager
Anusha Burla, Sr. Software Dev Engineer

Abstract:
Sharing and managing Route 53 resources and settings across your organization can quickly get complex and costly, as you scale to multiple VPCs and accounts. In this session of the Routing Loop, we will introduce Route 53 Profiles, a new capability that allows you to create a standard DNS configuration that may include one or more Route 53 private hosted zones, Route 53 Resolver DNS Firewall rule groups, and/or Resolver rules, and share the configuration across your VPCs and AWS accounts. Route 53 Profiles simplifies the management and association of Route 53 resources and settings across your organization, by enforcing a consistent configuration.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Getting to know Amazon VPC IP Address Manager

link.title: Getting to know Amazon VPC IP Address Manager

entry.content:
23 May 2024

Getting to know Amazon VPC IP Address Manager

Hosts:
Jamie Wenzel, Matt Lehwess

Guests:
Raunak Tibrewal, Ankit Chadha

Abstract:
Amazon VPC IP Address Manager (IPAM) is a service that simplifies IP address management. This service helps you plan, track, allocate and monitor your IP adddresses in a unified operational view across your AWS environment. Join us for a service overview, and live demonstration
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions

entry.title: Streamlining Your Network: AWS Cloud WAN and Cisco SD-WAN Integration

link.title: Streamlining Your Network: AWS Cloud WAN and Cisco SD-WAN Integration

entry.content:
23 May 2024

Streamlining Your Network: AWS Cloud WAN and Cisco SD-WAN Integration

Hosts:
Matt Lehwess, Jamie Wenzel

Guests:
AWS & Cisco

Abstract:
Join our session with experts from AWS and Cisco as they walk you through the integration of AWS Cloud WAN with Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN. Learn about each solution, discover how they work together, and see how you can manage AWS Cloud WAN using Cisco SD-WAN. We'll also include a live demo.
Session Feedback/Content Suggestions
